method.name: PingStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts pinging the specified hostname with the specified options, with output directed to the given output file descriptor. The returned opaque string functions as a handle for this particular ping. Multiple pings can be running at once.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: destination
arg.tp:docstring: Destination host to connect to.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options to pass to the ping command. Accepted keys include: broadcast (bool): Send broadcast pings. count (int default 4): Number of packets to send. interval (int): Time to wait between packets. numeric (bool): Print numeric remote hosts. packetsize (int): Size of each packet sent. v6 (bool): True for ipv6. waittime (int): Time to wait for a response. Unrecognized keys return a DBus error and print no output to the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this ping.

method.name: PingStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running ping.
method.arg: Handle to the ping to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running pings.

method.name: SystraceStart
method.tp:docstring: Start system/kernel tracing. If tracing is already enabled it is stopped first and any collected events are discarded. The kernel must have been configured to support tracing.

arg.name: categories
arg.tp:docstring: Trace event categories to enable. If none are specified then all known events are enabled. Multiple categories are specified separated by spaces.

method.name: SystraceStop
method.tp:docstring: Stop system/kernel tracing and write the collected event data.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send event data to.

method.name: SystraceStatus
method.tp:docstring: Return current status for system/kernel tracing including whether it is enabled, the tracing clock, and the set of events enabled.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: destination
arg.tp:docstring: Destination host[/port] to trace a path to.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options to pass to the tracepath command: numeric (bool): Print numeric remote hosts. v6 (bool): True for ipv6. Unrecognized keys return a DBus error and print no output to the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this ping.

method.name: TracePathStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running tracepath.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Handle to the tracepath to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running tracepaths.

method.name: GetRoutes
method.tp:docstring: Returns the routing table.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options: numeric (bool): Deprecated, numeric hosts are always given. v6 (bool): True for ipv6.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: The list of routes.

method.name: GetNetworkStatus
method.tp:docstring: Returns network information as a JSON string. See the design document for a rationale.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Network information as a JSON string.

method.name: GetPerfOutput
method.tp:docstring: Runs system-wide perf profiling. The profile parameters are selected by perf_args.

arg.name: duration_sec
arg.tp:docstring: Duration to run perf in seconds.

arg.name: perf_args
arg.tp:docstring: The perf parameters to pass to quipper, which will forward them to perf after checking they are safe.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Status code from running perf and serializing the output.

arg.name: perf_data
arg.tp:docstring: Perf report output data as a protobuf.

arg.name: perf_stat
arg.tp:docstring: Perf stat output data as a protobuf.

method.name: GetPerfOutputFd
method.tp:docstring: Runs system-wide perf profiling. The profile parameters are selected by perf_args. This method runs quipper asynchronously so that debugd isn't blocked for duration_sec. The DBus client reads the perf output using the file descriptor. Only one profiler session is allowed to run using this method. Calling this method while the profiler is running yields a DBus error. The profiler session can optionally be stopped using method StopPerf before duration_sec elapses.

arg.name: duration_sec
arg.tp:docstring: Duration to run perf in seconds.

arg.name: perf_args
arg.tp:docstring: The perf parameters to pass to quipper, which will forward them to perf after checking they are safe.

arg.name: stdout
arg.tp:docstring: quipper's stdout will be connected to this file descriptor.

arg.name: session_id
arg.tp:docstring: The identifier of the profiler session. Will be non-zero if the profiler is started successfully. It can be used in method StopPerf to stop the profiler and gather output right away.

method.name: StopPerf
method.tp:docstring: Stop the existing profiler session and gather perf output right away. If the collection started by GetPerfOutputFd has finished, calling this method will silently succeed.

arg.name: session_id
arg.tp:docstring: The profiler session ID returned from the GetPerfOutputFd method. It is used to stop the existing profiler session.

method.name: DumpDebugLogs
method.tp:docstring: Packages up system logs into a .tar(.gz) and returns it over the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: is_compressed
arg.tp:docstring: If true, output content should be compressed (.tar.gz), otherwise output content is uncompressed (.tar).

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to emit the .tar.gz file over.

method.name: SetDebugMode
method.tp:docstring: Enables or disables debug mode for a specified subsystem.

arg.name: subsystem
arg.tp:docstring: Subsystem to change the debug mode of. One of "cellular", "wifi", "ethernet" or "none".

method.name: GetLog
method.tp:docstring: Fetches the contents of a single system log, identified by name. See /src/log_tool.cc for a list of valid names.

method.name: GetAllLogs
method.tp:docstring: Returns all the system logs.

method.name: GetBigFeedbackLogs
method.tp:docstring: Fills the system logs for feedback reports in the file whose file descriptor is given. This is used for logs that are so big that they exceed the limits of D-Bus returning them.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to emit the logs to.

method.name: GetJournalLog
method.tp:docstring: Fills the journal log in export format for feedback reports in the file whose file descriptor is given.

arg.name: scrub
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to anonymize the log data.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to emit the logs to.

method.name: GetExample
method.tp:docstring: Example method. See /doc/hacking.md.

method.name: CupsAddAutoConfiguredPrinter
method.tp:docstring: Add a printer that can be auto-configured to CUPS. Immediately attempt to connect. Returns true if setup was successful.

method.name: CupsAddManuallyConfiguredPrinter
method.tp:docstring: Add a printer to CUPS using the passed PPD contents. Immediately attempt to connect. Returns true if setup was successful.

arg.name: ppd_contents
arg.tp:docstring: The contents of the CUPS Postscript Printer Driver for this printer. This data may optionally be gzip compressed.

method.name: CupsRemovePrinter
method.tp:docstring: Remove a printer from CUPS. Returns true if the printer was removed successfully.

arg.name: name
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the printer to remove.

method.name: GetInterfaces
method.tp:docstring: Returns information about network interfaces as a JSON string.

method.name: TestICMP
method.tp:docstring: Tests ICMP connectivity to a specified host.

method.name: TestICMPWithOptions
method.tp:docstring: Tests ICMP connectivity to a specified host (with options).

method.name: BatteryFirmware
method.tp:docstring: Runs BatteryFirmware utility.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Option to pass to the BatteryFirmware command: info: Get Battery Firmware Info. check: Check if AC Adapter is connected. update: Trigger Battery Firmware Update.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Battery command output.

method.name: Smartctl
method.tp:docstring: Runs Smartctl utility.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Option to pass to the Smartctl command: abort_test: aborts the offline test. attributes: prints device attributes. capabilities: prints generic smart capabilities. error: prints device error messages. health: prints device health status. selftest: prints offline test results. short_test: starts a short offline test.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Smartctl command output.

method.name: Mmc
method.tp:docstring: Runs mmc utility.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Option to pass to the mmc command: extcsd_read: print extcsd data from root device. extcsd_dump: print raw extcsd data from root device.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: `mmc` command output.

method.name: MemtesterStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts running memtester.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: memory
arg.tp:docstring: The amount of memory to allocate and test in megabytes.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle to the memtester.

method.name: MemtesterStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops running memtester.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Handle to the memtester to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running memtests.

method.name: BadblocksStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts running badblocks test.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle to the badblocks.

method.name: BadblocksStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops running badblocks.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Handle to the badblocks to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running badblocks.

method.name: PacketCaptureStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts a packet capture with the specified options, with diagnostic status directed to the "statfd" file descriptor and packet capture data sent to the "outfd" file descriptor. The returned opaque string functions as a handle for this particular packet capture. Multiple captures can be running at once. Captures can be initiated on Ethernet-like devices or WiFi devices in "client mode" (showing only Ethernet frames) by specifying the "device" parameter (see below). By specifying a channel, the script will find or create a "monitor mode" interface if one is available and produce an "over the air" packet capture. The name of the output packet capture file is sent to the output file descriptor.

arg.name: statfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send status information to.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send packet capture output to.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options to pass to the packet capture command. Accepted keys include: device (string): An existing device to perform a packet capture on. frequency (int): Radio frequency (in MHz) to perform capture on. ht_location (string): The string "above" or "below", representing the offset of any secondary channel used in a 40 MHz HT (high throughput) caputre. monitor_connection_on (string): Instead of providing the "frequency" and "ht_location" parameters above, this paramter specifies the name of a currently connected 802.11 interface. A packet capture is initated on the same channel as this connection. Unrecognized keys return a DBus error and print no output to the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this packet capture.

method.name: PacketCaptureStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running packet capture.
method.arg: Handle to the packet capture to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running packet captures.

method.name: LogKernelTaskStates
method.tp:docstring: Triggers show-task-states(T) SysRq. See https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/sysrq.txt.

method.name: UploadCrashes
method.tp:docstring: Triggers uploading of system crashes (the crash_sender program).

method.name: UploadSingleCrash
method.tp:docstring: Uploads a single crash report immediately. Crash report data is contained in the message.

arg.name: files
arg.tp:docstring: Array of files to include in the crash report. String is the base file name.

method.name: RemoveRootfsVerification
method.tp:docstring: Removes rootfs verification. Requires a system reboot before it will take effect. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: EnableBootFromUsb
method.tp:docstring: Enables OS booting from a USB image. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: ConfigureSshServer
method.tp:docstring: Sets up sshd to provide an SSH server immediately and on future reboots. Also installs the test SSH keys to allow access by cros tools. Requires that rootfs verification has been removed. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: SetUserPassword
method.tp:docstring: Sets both the system and dev mode password for the indicated account. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

arg.name: username
arg.tp:docstring: Username to set the new password for.

arg.name: password
arg.tp:docstring: Password to assign.

method.name: EnableChromeRemoteDebugging
method.tp:docstring: Sets up Chrome for remote debugging. It will take effect after a reboot and using port 9222. Requires that rootfs verification has been removed. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: EnableChromeDevFeatures
method.tp:docstring: Convenience function to enable a predefined set of tools from the Chrome UI. Equivalent to calling these functions in order: 1. EnableBootFromUsb() 2. ConfigureSshServer() 3. SetUserPassword("root", root_password) Requires that rootfs verification has been removed. If any sub-function fails, this function will exit with an error without attempting any further configuration or rollback. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

arg.name: root_password
arg.tp:docstring: Password to assign to the root user. If the string is empty, it will default to "test0000".

method.name: QueryDevFeatures
method.tp:docstring: Queries which dev features have been enabled. Each dev feature will be indicated by a bit flag in the return value. Flags are defined in the DevFeatureFlag enumeration. If the dev tools are unavailable (system is not in dev mode/pre-login state), the DEV_FEATURES_DISABLED flag will be set and the rest of the bits will always be set to 0.

arg.name: features
arg.tp:docstring: Feature enabled flags or DEV_FEATURES_DISABLED flag.

tp:enum.name: DevFeatureFlag
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Bit flags representing individual development features. Currently dbusxx-xml2cpp does not extract enum values, so any changes here should be manually flushed to platform/system_api/dbus/service_constants.h.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Dev features query is unavailable due to access restrictions.
Rootfs verification has been removed, including the required system reset.
Booting from USB has been enabled.
The SSH server has been configured to auto-start on boot and the test SSH keys have been installed. Both of these conditions must be met for this flag to be signaled.
The devmode root account password has been set.
The system root account password has been set.
The Chrome remote debugging feature has been enabled. Chrome will be listening on port 9222. The port is not publicly accessible. User needs to use SSH port forwarding to be able to access it.

method.name: EnableDevCoredumpUpload
method.tp:docstring: Allow uploading of device coredump files.

method.name: DisableDevCoredumpUpload
method.tp:docstring: Disallow uploading of device coredump files.

method.name: SetOomScoreAdj
method.tp:docstring: Set OOM score by writing scores to procfs /proc/pid/oom_score_adj. It is an operation which needs root privilege so needs to be handled carefully: 1. Only user chronos can request the operation. 2. It can only modify processes owned by chronos or run in Android container.

arg.name: scores
arg.tp:docstring: Arrays of (pid, score) pairs.

arg.name: out
arg.tp:docstring: Output from the helper of the operation. Empty on success.

method.name: SwapEnable
method.tp:docstring: Enable swap file usage via config files.

arg.name: size
arg.tp:docstring: Size (in MB) for the swap file.

arg.name: change_now
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to enable immediately, or wait until next reboot.

method.name: SwapDisable
method.tp:docstring: Disable swap file usage via config files.

arg.name: change_now
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to disable immediately, or wait until next reboot.

method.name: SwapStartStop
method.tp:docstring: Turn swap usage on/off (leaves config files alone).

arg.name: on
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to turn it on or off.

method.name: SwapStatus
method.tp:docstring: Show current swap status.

method.name: SwapSetParameter
method.tp:docstring: Persistently change the value of various parameters.

arg.name: command_name
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the swap subcommand, usually set_something.

arg.name: value
arg.tp:docstring: The unsigned integer value that some parameter is set to.

method.name: SetU2fFlags
method.tp:docstring: Modify u2fd daemon debugging/override flags.

arg.name: flags
arg.tp:docstring: Flags (comma separated) to force debugging features. See debugd::u2f_flags in system_api for supported flags.

method.name: GetU2fFlags
method.tp:docstring: Get u2fd daemon debugging/override flags.

arg.name: flags
arg.tp:docstring: Flags (comma separated) that are currently set. See debugd::u2f_flags in system_api for supported flags.

method.name: ContainerStarted
method.tp:docstring: Notify debugd that a container is starting up.

method.name: ContainerStopped
method.tp:docstring: Notify debugd that a container has stopped.

method.name: SetWifiPowerSave
method.tp:docstring: Enable/disable WiFi power save mode.

arg.name: enable
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to enable or disable.

method.arg: New power save mode, or error.

method.name: GetWifiPowerSave
method.tp:docstring: Show current WiFi power save mode.

method.name: RunShillScriptStart
method.tp:docstring: Run a shill debug script in a sandboxed environment.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: script
arg.tp:docstring: The script to run.

arg.name: script_args
arg.tp:docstring: The command line flags to pass to the script.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this run.

method.name: RunShillScriptStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running script.
method.arg: Handle to the script to stop.

method.name: StartVmConcierge
method.tp:docstring: Starts the virtual machine concierge service. Returns true if the service was successfully started and is available over dbus, false otherwise.
method.arg: Whether the concierge service is ready to handle requests.

method.name: StopVmConcierge
method.tp:docstring: Stops the virtual machine concierge service.

method.name: StartVmPluginDispatcher
method.tp:docstring: Starts the VM Plugin Dispatcher service. Returns true if the service was successfully started and is available over dbus, false otherwise.
method.arg: Whether the VM Plugin dispather service is ready to handle requests.

method.name: StopVmPluginDispatcher
method.tp:docstring: Stops the VM Plugin dispatcher service.

method.name: SetRlzPingSent
method.tp:docstring: Sets should_send_rlz_ping in RW_VPD to 0. Upon success, proceeds to remove rlz_embargo_end_date in RW_VPD.

method.name: UpdateAndVerifyFWOnUsbStart
method.tp:docstring: Start updating the GSC FW of the USB-connected device (only if the device's FW is not up-to-date) and verifying AP and EC RO FW integrity of the device.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to forward process output to.

arg.name: image_file
arg.tp:docstring: Path to the local Cr50 image file.

arg.name: ro_db_dir
arg.tp:docstring: Path to the local RO descriptor files folder.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for the VerifyRo process.

method.name: UpdateAndVerifyFWOnUsbStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running VerifyRo.
method.arg: Handle to the VerifyRo process to stop.

method.name: SetSchedulerConfiguration
method.tp:docstring: Set the scheduler configuration policy.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Whether setting the policy was succesful.
